intro: Corydalis nubicola, commonly known as the cloudland corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant has slender, creeping stems and produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at higher elevations. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
